page.title: 08The Wellington Monument
page.content: Anyone passing by Wellington cannot but fail to notice the Monument standing high on the Blackdown Hills. This obelisk is a very popular attraction for both visitors and in habitants alike. The Monument was built in 1817 to comemerate the military achievments of the Duke of Wellington who defeated Napoleon at the battle of Waterloo. The Duke of Wellington was granted the Lordship of the Manor of Wellington Borough in about 1813.Why he chose to use the title Wellington is not understood. The Monument as we know it now was mainly built in 1860.It rises to a hieght of 175ft.and can be climbed by an internal staircase of 235 steps to a viewing chamber.The National Trust are now the custodians.
